questions.question: The winter session ………………………. on December 5th.
questions.description: The simple present is sometimes used to talk about future events that are part of a time table.

questions.question: I will call you if I ……………………….. time.
questions.description: The simple present is often used in subordinate clauses with a future meaning.

questions.question: ……………………….. we call the police?
questions.description: Shall is used when asking for instructions.

questions.question: ……………………….. you make me a cup of tea?
questions.description: Will is used to give instructions.

questions.question: The plane ……………………….. at three o’clock.
questions.description: Either could be used here however, the simple present is more common.

questions.question: By next January, we ………………………….. here for ten years.
questions.description: The future perfect is used to say that something will have been completed by a certain time in the future.

questions.question: I promise I ……………………….. you this evening.
Let’s have something to eat, …………………………. we?
questions.description: We use shall in question tags after let’s.

questions.question: ………………………….. a ghost?
questions.description: The present perfect is commonly used with the expressions ever, never, already etc.

questions.question: I ………………………… James in the morning and he said that he was quitting.
questions.description: The simple past is the most normal tense for talking about finished events.

questions.question: She ………………………… all her life in India.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to mean up to now.
